alert.note: Alert for Butler; Lancaster; Saunders; Seward (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 12 at 3:18PM CDT until May 12 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 400 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN LANCASTER...NORTHEASTERN SEWARD...SOUTHEASTERN BUTLER AND SOUTHWESTERN SAUNDERS COUNTIES... At 318 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Pleasant Dale, or 11 miles southeast of Seward, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...At 315 PM, trained spotters reported quarter size hail 2 miles ESE of Pleasant Dale. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Malcolm around 330 PM CDT. Garland around 335 PM CDT. Bee around 345 PM CDT. Dwight around 350 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Branched Oak State Recreation Area and Pawnee State Recreation Area. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for southeastern and east central Nebraska. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
